meanings.definition: Pertaining to or characterized by egotism.
meanings.sent1: His egotistic behavior made it difficult for others to work with him.
meanings.sent2: She always talks about herself, showing her egotistic nature.
meanings.sent3: In a funny twist, his egotistic tendencies led him to believe he was the best at everything.
meanings.sent4: Her egotistic attitude towered over the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The egotistic cat believed the whole world revolved around her, demanding attention at all times.

meanings.definition: Having an exaggerated sense of self-importance.
meanings.sent1: The egotistic actor refused to rehearse with the rest of the cast.
meanings.sent2: He always brags about his achievements, displaying his egotistic personality.
meanings.sent3: Despite his lack of talent, he had an egotistic belief in his own greatness.
meanings.sent4: Her egotistic ego was as large as a hot air balloon, floating above everyone else.
meanings.sent5: The egotistic king demanded constant praise and admiration from his subjects.

meanings.sent1: Her egotistic actions showed she only cared about herself.
meanings.sent2: He never considers others' feelings, always acting in an egotistic manner.
meanings.sent3: In a surprising turn of events, his egotistic behavior backfired, leaving him alone.
meanings.sent4: The egotistic child refused to share his toys with anyone, claiming everything as his own.
meanings.sent5: The egotistic boss only thought about his own success, disregarding the hard work of his employees.
